text: This is Unit 17 of Pimsleur's Speak and Read Essential French 3.
Mr. Daniel's nephew is coming to visit him.
Le neveu de M. Daniel vient lui rendre visite.
On m'a dit que votre neveu vient vous rendre visite.
Oui, c'est vrai. Il vient me voir ce week-end.
Que fait votre neveu en France ?
Cette année, il a fait des études à Paris.
Et maintenant, il veut voyager un peu.
In this conversation, the woman said,
Which means, they told me in English.
Écoutez encore une fois cette conversation.

Suppose you want to show an acquaintance a photograph of your niece.
Say, I would like to show you a photo.
Ah, the photo of your niece, right ?
Ah, la photo de votre nièce, n'est-ce pas ?
Say, yes, this is my sister's daughter.
Voilà la fille de ma soeur.
Voilà la fille de ma soeur.
She has just finished her studies.
Elle vient de terminer ses études.
Where did she do her studies ?
She did her studies in New York.
Elle a fait ses études à New York.
She is going to get married in September.
Elle va se marier en septembre.
Elle va se marier en septembre.
It will certainly be a beautiful wedding.
Ce sera certainement un beau mariage.
The whole family is going to come.
And also a few friends from Europe.
They invited a lot of people.
Ils ont invité beaucoup de monde.
Ils ont invité beaucoup de monde.
She's going to take a trip through Europe.
Elle va faire un voyage en Europe.
Is she also coming to France?
Est-ce qu'elle vient aussi en France?
And afterwards, she's going to Germany.
Et ensuite, elle va en Allemagne.
She has some friends in Germany, right?
Elle a des amis en Allemagne, n'est-ce pas?
Yes, her best friend now lives in Germany.
Sa meilleure amie habite maintenant en Allemagne.
My husband and I, we would like to invite you to our evening party.
Mon mari et moi, nous aimerions vous inviter à notre soirée.
When will your evening party take place?
Say that your evening party will take place on Friday.
You want to say, I accept with pleasure.
Suppose you're Mr. Daniels and you see an acquaintance, Mrs. Fleury, sitting with a group of people. After greeting you, how does she ask you if you want to sit down?
Do you want to sit down, Mr. Daniels?
Do you want to sit down, Mr. Daniels?
Here's how to say, we are speaking about the United States.
Repétez, vous êtes en train de se passer.
Meaning you're in the process of speaking.
Nous sommes en train de parler.
